caption:
1/14
I paid a protocol to take my money.

Then they offered to give it back.

Let me explain.

2/14
The last cycle bled us dry.

We were the yield farm. The test dummies. The exit liquidity for VCs who think "community" is a line item on a pitch deck.

Every governance token I held was a vote on how fast I'd get rugged.

I was done.

3/14
You ever watch the transaction fees on a DEX you use daily and realize you're just paying for some founder's next yacht?

You don't own the protocol.
You're just the digital sharecropper renting the land.
Your liquidity is their treasury.

4/14
Then this thing 
@MMTFinance
 pops up on 
@SuiNetwork
.

"Momentum Title Deeds," they called them. NFTs for protocol ownership.

My scam alert went berserk. Sounded like another cringe metaverse JPEG flip with extra steps.

I almost kept scrolling.

5/14
But one line stopped me.

"10% refundable deposit."

REFUNDABLE.
IN CRYPTO.

I actually laughed out loud. No way. Had to be a honeypot. A new, innovative way to steal my money.

This space has given me trust issues.

6/14
So obviously I aped the deposit.

It was the dumbest safe bet I'd ever seen.
Worst case, I lose a small bag.
Best case, I get my money back.

Felt like playing Russian Roulette with a water pistol.

7/14
Claim day. My hands are sweating.

I click "Open Pack".
The little animation spins. My degen life flashes before my eyes.

The screen flashes.

Not Common.
Not Rare.

E P I C.

100% TGE unlock. My entire allocation. Instantly.

8/14
And then it clicked.

This wasn't a JPEG.
It's a f*cking deed. To the plumbing.
I don't just trade on the exchange.

I OWN A PIECE OF THE DAMN CASINO.

9/14
The fees from swaps?
A cut of that hits my wallet now.

That new project launching on their @TokenGenLab pad?
I get airdropped tokens just for holding this "Title Deed".

I am no longer the farmed.
I am the farmer.

10/14
Last week I voted on a protocol upgrade. A real one. Not some bullshit proposal about the Discord emoji budget.

My vote wasn't just a signal. It was a command.

The feeling is‚Ä¶ different. It feels like power.

11/14
Stop being the liquidity another man harvests.
Stop begging for airdrops you have to grind 40 hours for.
Stop renting your spot in DeFi.

The game is shifting from "user" to "owner".
Are you going to be a tenant for life?

12/14
This is the new meta.

Infrastructure as an NFT.
Perpetual claims on real yield.
Ownership you can hold in your own wallet, not a promise in a whitepaper.

This is DeFi's landlord era.

13/14
The Founder Phase for these deeds is still live but not for long.

You can look at the price and see a cost.
Or you can look at it and see the
